byline.contributor: Laurie Goodstein contributed reporting from Washington, and Michael D. Shear from New York.
byline.original: By PETER BAKER and JIM YARDLEY

abstract: Pope Francis addresses joint session of Congress, asking for unity to heal 'open wounds' of world plagued by greed, hatred, poverty and pollution; beseeches lawmakers to break out of their long period of partisan bickering and inaction, and work together to address problems on both sides of aisle.
lead_paragraph: Speaking to lawmakers on Thursday, the pope issued a call to action on issues largely favored by liberals, including a critique of the excesses of capitalism and a defense of immigration.

headline.main: Pope Francis, in Congress, Pleads for Unity on World’s Woes
